trans-unit.source: Using the Application Insights portal
trans-unit.target: Using the Application Insights portal

trans-unit.source: Overview of usage analytics with Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Overview of usage analytics with Application Insights

trans-unit.source: After you have <linkText>set up Application Insights on your project</linkText><title></title>, telemetry data about your app's performance and usage will appear in your project's Application Insights resource in the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: After you have <linkText>set up Application Insights on your project</linkText><title></title>, telemetry data about your app's performance and usage will appear in your project's Application Insights resource in the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title> and browse to the Application Insights resource that you created for your app.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title> and browse to the Application Insights resource that you created for your app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click Browse, select Application Insights, then your app.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click Browse, select Application Insights, then your app.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The overview page gives you some basic telemetry, plus links to more.
trans-unit.target: The overview page gives you some basic telemetry, plus links to more.

trans-unit.source: The contents depend on the type of your app, and can be customized.
trans-unit.target: The contents depend on the type of your app, and can be customized.

trans-unit.source: The overview blade (page) for your app shows the most important charts for monitoring performance and usage.
trans-unit.target: The overview blade (page) for your app shows the most important charts for monitoring performance and usage.

trans-unit.source: The contents depend on the type of your app, and in any case you can customize it.
trans-unit.target: The contents depend on the type of your app, and in any case you can customize it.

trans-unit.source: Choose what you want to see on the overview.
trans-unit.target: Choose what you want to see on the overview.

trans-unit.source: In Customize, you can insert section titles, drag tiles and charts around, remove items, and add new tiles and charts from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: In Customize, you can insert section titles, drag tiles and charts around, remove items, and add new tiles and charts from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: ![Click "...", Customize.
trans-unit.target: ![Click "...", Customize.

trans-unit.source: Drag tiles and charts.
trans-unit.target: Drag tiles and charts.

trans-unit.source: Add tiles from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: Add tiles from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: ](./media/app-insights-portal/020-customize.png)
trans-unit.target: ](./media/app-insights-portal/020-customize.png)

trans-unit.source: To add a new chart to the blade:
trans-unit.target: To add a new chart to the blade:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In Metrics Explorer, choose Add Chart</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In Metrics Explorer, choose Add Chart</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select an existing or new chart to edit what it shows:
trans-unit.target: Select an existing or new chart to edit what it shows:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select one or more metrics</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select one or more metrics</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can display more than one metric on a chart, though there are restrictions about the combinations that can be displayed together.
trans-unit.target: You can display more than one metric on a chart, though there are restrictions about the combinations that can be displayed together.

trans-unit.source: As soon as you choose one metric, some of the others are disabled.
trans-unit.target: As soon as you choose one metric, some of the others are disabled.

trans-unit.source: If you coded <linkText>custom metrics</linkText><title></title> into your app (calls to TrackMetric and TrackEvent) they will be listed here.
trans-unit.target: If you coded <linkText>custom metrics</linkText><title></title> into your app (calls to TrackMetric and TrackEvent) they will be listed here.

trans-unit.source: Select a chart or grid, switch on grouping and pick a property to group by:
trans-unit.target: Select a chart or grid, switch on grouping and pick a property to group by:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select Grouping On, then set select a property in Group By</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select Grouping On, then set select a property in Group By</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you coded custom metrics into your app and they include <linkText>property values</linkText><title></title>, you'll be able to select the property in the list.
trans-unit.target: If you coded custom metrics into your app and they include <linkText>property values</linkText><title></title>, you'll be able to select the property in the list.

trans-unit.source: Is the chart too small for segmented data?
trans-unit.target: Is the chart too small for segmented data?

trans-unit.source: Adjust its height:
trans-unit.target: Adjust its height:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Adjust the slider</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Adjust the slider</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To see just the metrics for a selected set of property values:
trans-unit.target: To see just the metrics for a selected set of property values:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click Filter, expand a property, and check some values</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click Filter, expand a property, and check some values</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you don't select any values for a particular property, it's the same as selecting them all: there is no filter on that property.
trans-unit.target: If you don't select any values for a particular property, it's the same as selecting them all: there is no filter on that property.

trans-unit.source: Notice the counts of events alongside each property value.
trans-unit.target: Notice the counts of events alongside each property value.

trans-unit.source: When you select values of one property, the counts alongside other property values are adjusted.
trans-unit.target: When you select values of one property, the counts alongside other property values are adjusted.

trans-unit.source: When you've created some charts, save them as a favorite.
trans-unit.target: When you've created some charts, save them as a favorite.

trans-unit.source: You can choose whether to share it with other team members, if you use an organizational account.
trans-unit.target: You can choose whether to share it with other team members, if you use an organizational account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose Favorite</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose Favorite</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To see the blade again, go to the overview blade and open Favorites:
trans-unit.target: To see the blade again, go to the overview blade and open Favorites:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In the Overview blade, choose Favorites</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In the Overview blade, choose Favorites</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you chose Relative time range when you saved, the blade will be updated with the latest metrics.
trans-unit.target: If you chose Relative time range when you saved, the blade will be updated with the latest metrics.

trans-unit.source: If you chose Absolute time range, it will show the same data every time.
trans-unit.target: If you chose Absolute time range, it will show the same data every time.

trans-unit.source: If you edit a blade but then you'd like to get back to the original saved set, just click Reset.
trans-unit.target: If you edit a blade but then you'd like to get back to the original saved set, just click Reset.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In the buttons at the top of Metric Explorer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In the buttons at the top of Metric Explorer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Open diagnostic search:
trans-unit.target: Open diagnostic search:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Open diagnostic search</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Open diagnostic search</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Open the Filter blade and choose the event types you want to see.
trans-unit.target: Open the Filter blade and choose the event types you want to see.

trans-unit.source: (If, later, you want to restore the filters with which you opened the blade, click Reset.)
trans-unit.target: (If, later, you want to restore the filters with which you opened the blade, click Reset.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose Filter and select telemetry types</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose Filter and select telemetry types</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can filter events on the values of their properties.
trans-unit.target: You can filter events on the values of their properties.

trans-unit.source: The available properties depend on the event types you selected.
trans-unit.target: The available properties depend on the event types you selected.

trans-unit.source: For example, pick out requests with a specific response code.
trans-unit.target: For example, pick out requests with a specific response code.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Expand a property and choose a value</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Expand a property and choose a value</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Choosing no values of a particular property has the same effect as choosing all values; it switches off filtering on that property.
trans-unit.target: Choosing no values of a particular property has the same effect as choosing all values; it switches off filtering on that property.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the counts to the right of the filter values show how many occurrences there are in the current filtered set.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the counts to the right of the filter values show how many occurrences there are in the current filtered set.

trans-unit.source: In this example, it's clear that the Reports/Employees request results in the majority of the 500 errors:
trans-unit.target: In this example, it's clear that the Reports/Employees request results in the majority of the 500 errors:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Expand a property and choose a value</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Expand a property and choose a value</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Additionally if you want to also see what other events were happening during this time, you can check Include events with undefined properties.
trans-unit.target: Additionally if you want to also see what other events were happening during this time, you can check Include events with undefined properties.

trans-unit.source: When you've set all the filters you want, you can save the search as a favorite.
trans-unit.target: When you've set all the filters you want, you can save the search as a favorite.

trans-unit.source: If you work in an organizational account, you can choose whether to share it with other team members.
trans-unit.target: If you work in an organizational account, you can choose whether to share it with other team members.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click Favorite, set the name, and click Save</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click Favorite, set the name, and click Save</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To see the search again, go to the overview blade and open Favorites:
trans-unit.target: To see the search again, go to the overview blade and open Favorites:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Favorites tile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Favorites tile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you saved with Relative time range, the re-opened blade has the latest data.
trans-unit.target: If you saved with Relative time range, the re-opened blade has the latest data.

trans-unit.source: If you saved with Absolute time range, you see the same data every time.
trans-unit.target: If you saved with Absolute time range, you see the same data every time.
